'''Misandry''' is an exaggerated pathological aversion towards [[men]]. While usually ascribed to women, it is also possible for men to be misandrist. Unlike [[misogyny]] (a pathological aversion towards [[women]]), misandry has been little discussed or investigated. Some [[Masculism|masculists]] maintain that misandry has been rampant for thirty years, due to feminist advocacy, and has become a social pathology. Some [[Feminism|feminists]] believe that, while misogyny is a social disease, misandry doesn't exist. Others in both feminist and masculist camps consider the "war of the sexes" arising from traditional gender roles to be a powerful source of both misogyny and misandry.
See also: * [[Misogyny]] * [[Misanthropy]] * [[Lesbian separatism]]
